availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: A. D. Haynes (Mercer County, constable, deputy marshal)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, constable and deputy U.S. marshal. Kentucky native. Married Jane Haynes. Father of Mary Ellen Haynes, Guilford R. Haynes, Maria Louisa Haynes, and Eugenia Haynes. Constable in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Deputy U.S. marshal in Mercer County in 1860. Justice of the peace of Mercer County c1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 271B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 714.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 49A.
KYR--0001-004-3228.
